definition: plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: The accommodation for the press was makeshift at best.
sentences.chinese: 遷就新聞界充其量只是個權宜之計。

sentences.english: These may end up being stop-gap measure.
sentences.chinese: 這些可能在最終都只是一些權宜之計。

sentences.english: The bailout bill is a classic example of expediency over effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 援助賬單是一個權宜之計的經典範本。

sentences.english: But both are the refuge of political and economic opportunists.
sentences.chinese: 但兩者都是政治及經濟機會主義者的權宜之計。

sentences.english: It is what it is, a matter of expediency.
sentences.chinese: 但就是這樣，一個權宜之計。

sentences.english: So the drugs are kind of a "Band-Aid solution, " Khalili explained.
sentences.chinese: 哈利利博士解釋說，所以這些藥物只是某種權宜之計。

sentences.english: But to date, there have been only short-term, stop-gap measures.
sentences.chinese: 但迄今爲止，政府只採取了短期的權宜之計。

sentences.english: But that would be crassly expedient.
sentences.chinese: 但那將是一個愚蠢的權宜之計。

definition: to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to take turns/to work by roster
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
